entry.title: MariaDB seconds behind issue fixed
entry.content:
We (my friend Vishnu and I) had reported a bug with MariaDB 10.0.4. Just got an update that the issue is fixed now! Here are the details about the bug: We had setup maria 10.0.4 for multisource replication. It was replicating from a Percona 5.5 master. When we started replication, Maria was a day behind its master. It was working fine, but we noticed this phenomenon: When we execute show all slaves status consecutively, the ‘seconds_behind_master’ flips from 0 to XXX and XXX to 0. Note: XXX is some positive number.

Reference: https://mariadb.atlassian.net/browse/MDEV-5114

The fix is deployed in MariaDB 10.0.10.
